scenarioDescription:
The HIP 48714 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 48714 is a star with 0.58 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

HIP 48714 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 48714 system


HIP 48714 b

HIP 48714 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2020-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 48714 b is 22.912 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 48714 b is 5.110 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HIP 48714 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HIP 48714, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HIP 48714 - System With 1 Exoplanet
